ðŸŒŒ Custom AI Workshop

Collaborate with us to build a workshop focused around your projects, specialised to your team.

About

Co-design a focused AI workshop for your team and your projects. We will work with you to support your team on their AI adoption journey.

Below is a list of topics that we can build upon.

Topics
Text processing
About

Also called "Natural language processing (NLP)", this is a technique for getting computers to work with and understand text.

Key Applications
  • Categorising documents,
  • and predicting "sentiment" ("good" or "bad").
More examples from recent research
Model interpretability
About

Also referred to as "explainability", this is the general approach of working to understand why a model made a certain decision.

Key Applications
  • Debugging a model while developing it,
  • explaining model decisions to end-users,
  • and, understanding and correcting dataset biases.
More examples from recent research
Model compression
About

The business of taking large models and making them run efficiently on mobile devices or other "embedded" hardware.

Key Applications
  • Making a model run fast on a phone,
  • enabling privacy by allowing the models to train on the phone,
  • and, running models entirely in the browser.
More examples from recent research
Computer vision
About

The field of learning from images and videos. For most of us, our experience of the world is strongly visual so there is an almost endless supply of data and information in this area.

Key Applications
  • Identifying objects in video,
  • tracking or counting objects in video or satellite imagery,
  • and, self-driving cars.

This is a rich area, with many applications.

More examples from recent research
Creative AI
About

The art of using data and algoritms to design new paintings, clothes, stories, and experiences.

Key Applications
  • Producing, and discovering, new art,
  • generating new images, audio and videos,
  • and extending peoples creative capacity.
More examples from recent research
Quantum machine learning
About

An emerging field that combines quantum computing and machine learning.

The applications in this field are still being researched.

Key Applications
  • Machine learning on "quantum" data,
  • faster computation of certain algorithms on classical data,
  • discovery of faster classical algorithms.
Tools
TensorFlow
About

A Python-focused library for deep learning. Widely used through-out industry and research to develp models and run them in production.

Key Areas
  • Building and training models,
  • training and inference pipelines,
  • running models in the browser through TensorFlow.js,
  • visualising models through TensorBoard.
  • debugging models,
  • and, deploying models in production.
PyTorch
About

Another Python-focused library for deep learning. Used widely by NLP researchers.

Key Areas
  • Building and training models,
  • training and inference pipelines,
  • debugging models,
  • and deploying models in production.
Essential Details
Duration Negotiable.
Attendance 20 people, maximum. No minimum.
Costs Ranges from $5,000 to $20,000.
Location Your office or ours.
Prerequisites Based on content.

Please get in touch to learn more!

Express interest or Get in contact

â˜• About Your Instructors

During the workshop you will be working with Noon and Ruth.

GitHub | LinkedIn | Blog | Calendly

Noon van der Silk is the founder of Braneshop and lead trainer.

Noon has 18+ years experience in various forms of software engineering, application development, and the design and implementation of machine learning + AI systems. Within AI he has a special interest in the field of computer vision and interactive art.

Noon has a research background, obtaining a Masters in Pure Mathematics, with a focus on quantum computing.

Noon is particularly passionate about empowering people through skill development.

LinkedIn

Dr Ruth Pearson is the co-founder of Braneshop, as well as a researcher, trainer and mentor.

Ruth has a cosmic-microwave-background in physics, with a PhD in cosmology, along with academic experience in Europe, U.S.A. and Australia. She loves maths, science and cats and wants to use AI to aid vet medicine.

As a teacher, Ruth is particularly interested in helping people to gain a deep, complete, and enjoyable understanding of concepts.
